verses.roman:
prāte uṭhi' āilā vipra bhaṭṭathāri-ghare
tāhāra uddeśe prabhu āilā satvare

synonyms: prāte—in the morning; uṭhi'-rising from bed; āilā—came; vipra—the brāhmaṇa Kṛṣṇadāsa; bhaṭṭathāri-ghare—to the place of the Bhaṭṭathāris; tāhāra uddeśe—for him; prabhu—Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu; āilā—came; satvare—very soon.
translation: Allured by the Bhaṭṭathāris, Kṛṣṇadāsa went to their place early in the morning. The Lord also went there very quickly just to find him out.
